sub_title: Copernicus Sentinel-1 Payload Manager at European Space Agency
summary:
I work for the European Space Agency in a combined Technical and Management Role which enables me to maintain links with Industry and keep abreast of technical development whilst at the same time lead a great team of Engineers working on the Sentinel-1 Payload.

I got into the Space Industry quite by chance when I accompanied one of my friends to a recruitment Seminar held by Matra Marconi Space in Plymouth University where I was studying. I had no intention of applying for a job in Space until I started talking to an Engineer who told me about the project he was working on.  This involved exploration into deep space in order to see what was beyond our universe. Thinking about the Universe and what was out there captured my imagination and started my love affair with the Space Industry. As a result I immediately signed up and was lucky enough to be called for an Interview. I started my career in Space with Matra Marconi Space, now known as Astrium Ltd, in June 1997. Since then I have been involved in many Space projects mainly centered around Earth Observation and Synthetic Aperture Radar which allows us to monitor our Planet continuously for many applications. I have met a lot of wonderful people in the Space Industry, most of which tend to stay and it is like being part of a large family.

profile_positions.title: GMES Sentinel-1 Payload Manager

profile_positions.description:
I was tasked to provide onsite Management support to a team of Astrium Ground System Engineers and the Ground System AIV Manager who were building the Operational Ground Control Centre for the Galileo Satellites. This included developing a close working relationship with the resident ESA team and working closely to ensure that the ESA expectations were met and at the same time Astrium Management and Contractual requirements were respected.
My responsibilities included:
Improving the team moral whilst on long term secondment
Supporting the AIV Manager and provided an interface between them and the ESA resident team
Generating and maintaining a clear Project Plan showing the day to day activities to ensure key Milestone were achieved for Astrium Senior Management and ESA
Co-ordination of Subcontract companies who were providing support to Astrium
Co-ordinating support from Astrium Ltd as needed to support testing activities and problem solving during test
profile_positions.title: Galileo Ground Control System AIV Management Support

profile_positions.description:
As the Industrial Manager for the Astrium Ltd SAR Electronics Subsystem my responsibilities included:
Identifying the Industrial consortium involved in the SES development whilst respecting the Geographical Return constraints placed on the Programme
Supporting the Proposal process
Preparing the Invitation for Tender packs for inclusion onto EMITS
Co-ordinating the review teams for the Proposal produced as a results of the Invitations for Tender
Final selection of the subcontractors
Negotiation and Contract Kick Off with the selected Subcontractors
Management of the Subcontract Managers to ensure the Subcontracted Elements were developed and Procured in line with the Sentinel-1 SES requirements
Progression and Management fo the Subcontract Companies up to the successful completion of their Critical Design Reviews

The role was also one of Deputy Project Manager for the Sentinel-1 SES and as such internal Astrium Management responsibilities were:
Co-ordination of the System Team ensuring suitable support to the review of Subcontract Design documents
Preparation for Monthly Project reviews to Astrium Senior Management including review of Schedule Costs and Risks
Preparation of Bi Monthly Progress reports and co-ordination of the team to provide the reports on time
Support to the Project Manager in Management discussions with the Industrial Hierarchy
Preparation of Contract Change Notes working closely with Contracts
Close co-operation with the Project Control function to ensure the Project critical path was well understood and actively managed
Close co-operation with Engineering Manager to ensure the Project Risk and Opportunities were proactively managed and appropriate actions placed and updated on a regular basis.
During my time in this position I trained for and achieved the PRINCE 2 Project Management Qualification and became a member of the Institute of Project Managers.
profile_positions.title: Sentinel-1 Industrial Manager

profile_positions.description:
In July 2002 I was promoted to Senior System Engineer which meant that I was now responsible for a complete Subsystem. This subsystem was the L-Band Radar Antenna Subsystem that was being studied by Astrium Ltd under the TerraSAR-L banner. My responsibilities included:
Generation of the L-Band SAR Requirements Specification;
Generation and Maintenance of the SAR Budget included Link budgets for the System Prime who were Alcatel France;
Coordination of the System Engineers providing inputs and Analysis into the Requirements reviews and the PDR
Support to the Instrument team with regards the Performance Analysis of the SAR including analysis of NESZ, DTAR and data rates
Analysis of test data from Breadboarding using MATLAB
Analysis of Pulsed Code Calibration and generation of a MATLAB tool to process complex Chirp signals
I was also in charge of a team of Engineers who were tasked with the development of the next generation of SAR Electronics Subsystems upto 1 GHz Bandwidth using novel techniques. This was a joint venture with Astrium GmbH and breadboards were designed and manufactured to prove the concept. My responsibilities apart from managing the team were to co-ordinate, as the deputy Project Manager with my counterpart in Astrium GmbH, weekly meetings to asses progress and develop and good across team working relationship. I also organized joint reviews with my German colleagues and presented with my team our results which were well received. This was my first taste in a management role and I found that I enjoyed leading a good team which achieved good results. I then went on a Silver belt as well as a number of Project Management training courses with Astrium which further developed my leadership capabilities.
profile_positions.title: Senior System Engineer

profile_positions.description: During my time as a System Engineer I developed my skills in the generation of requirements using Doors. This also allowed the tracking and linking of requirements from the Customer requirements right down through the system to Equipment level and lower if necessary. The generation and maintenance of System level budgets and liaison with experts was also developed to gain a good understanding of the system to allow for the complete verification in line with the Customer expectations. I also gained experience in interfacing directly with the Customer in Major reviews and presentations. This included many technical presentations and allowed to author and co-author papers on the L-Band Radar modeling work I was involved with at the time.
profile_positions.title: System Engineer

profile_positions.description: I started my career in the Space industry with Astrium Ltd formerly known as Matra Marconi Space as a graduate Engineer after gaining my Honours Degree from Plymouth University in 1997. As I was on a two year graduate Programme I had the chance to work in various parts of the company to gain experience and find out more about the different aspects of Engineering in the Space Industry. During my graduate years I worked on a /diverse array of Projects including ASAR TR Modules, ASAR TCIU, Artemis FGU, Metop and Waveguide Filter Tuning. My role on these Project was as a test Engineer which gave me a hands on experience with the Hardware after it had been designed. During the last part of my graduate Programme I spent six months in the Directorate of Science and Radar working on ASAR, RadarSAT and Metop predominantly helping in the System Design aspects that required RF Modeling for support to reviews etc. This lead me to aspire towards a career in Design and specifically the area of RF Design. I started as an Assistant Engineer in the Directorate of Science and Radar in June 1999 and after training in HP UNIX, Fortran and HP Advanced Design System I produced RF Models for use across a range of Projects to allow the generation of RF Budgets and RF Requirements into System and Subsystem level requirements specifications. This lead to roles on Metop and LSAR as the RF System Engineer where my responsibilities included Producing realistic RF Models of Equipments that could be used to fault find and during investigations. The Model produced for Metop was used for RF Compatibility modeling as the Metop Satellite had many Transmitters and Receivers from different instruments that could interact with each other. This needed modeling using ADS as well as a full life size Model where the Engineering Models of each Antenna were tested with each other over a dedicated test campaign. The S-Parameter results were then analyzed and fed into the ADS model for future reference and use.
